page.title: 03 - POPULATION SHIFTS
page.content: The indigenous population, originally predominently agricultural have, over the years gradually lost their importance to this part of West Sussex. A few children live in the area but there are far more people of pensionable age. A large house is at present being converted into a residential rest home. The majority of the local inhabitants do not now work in the area of the survey, but commute to the main centres of employment in Horsham, Crawley, the south coastal towns, and to a lesser extent, but by no means insignificant, to London and its surrounding urban spillover. The area is also a desirable area in which to live, thus making more problems for those few remaining local workers because of the effect on house prices and rents.
